sn6.6:1.2: Now at that time the Buddha had gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.
sn6.6:1.3: Then the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa went to the Buddha and stationed themselves one by each door-post. But Subrahmā said to Suddhāvāsa,
sn6.6:1.4: “Good sir, it’s the wrong time to pay homage to the Buddha.
sn6.6:1.5: He has gone into retreat for the day’s meditation.
sn6.6:1.6: But such and such Brahmā realm is successful and prosperous, while the Brahmā living there is negligent.
sn6.6:1.7: Come, let’s go to that Brahmā realm and inspire awe in that Brahmā!”
sn6.6:2.1: Then, as easily as a strong person would extend or contract their arm, they vanished from in front of the Buddha and appeared in that Brahmā realm.
sn6.6:2.2: That Brahmā saw those Brahmās coming off in the distance and said to them,
sn6.6:2.3: “Well now, good sirs, where have you come from?”
sn6.6:2.4: “Good sir, we’ve come from the presence of the Blessed One, the perfected one, the fully awakened Buddha.
sn6.6:2.5: Shouldn’t you go to attend on that Blessed One?”
sn6.6:3.1: When they had spoken, that Brahmā refused to accept their advice. He multiplied himself a thousand times and said to Subrahmā,
sn6.6:3.2: “Good sir, can’t you see that I have such psychic power?”
sn6.6:3.4: “Since I have such psychic power and might, what other ascetic or brahmin should I go to and attend upon?”
sn6.6:4.1: Then Subrahmā multiplied himself two thousand times and said to that Brahmā,
sn6.6:4.2: “Good sir, can’t you see that I have such psychic power?”
sn6.6:4.4: “That Buddha has even more psychic power and might than you or me.
sn6.6:4.5: Shouldn’t you go to attend on that Blessed One?”
sn6.6:4.6: Then that Brahmā addressed Subrahmā in verse:
sn6.6:5.1: “There are three hundreds of phoenixes, four of swans, and five of eagles.
sn6.6:5.2: This palace belongs to him who practiced absorption.
sn6.6:6.3: A clever person who has seen the deficiency in form,
sn6.6:6.4: its chronic trembling, takes no pleasure in it.”
sn6.6:7.1: Then after inspiring awe in that Brahmā, the independent brahmās Subrahmā and Suddhāvāsa vanished right there.
sn6.6:7.2: And after some time that Brahmā went to attend on the Buddha.
